New Records: The Cavaliers became the 12th team in NBA history to start a season 11-0.
The Cavaliers ended their NBA-record streak of scoring 110 points in 10 consecutive wins to open a season.
Key Match Events: Garland put the Cavaliers ahead for good at 97-96 with two free throws.
The Cavaliers answered with 10 straight points after Johnson buried a 3-pointer with 4:23 left to extend Brooklyn’s lead to 96-89.
Pre-Game Insights: New coach Kenny Atkinson admitted “there was a little extra” at stake for him facing Brooklyn for the first time since being fired by the Nets in 2020.
Post-Match Reflections: Mobley took the message to heart, making 10 of 11 field goal attempts.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers are two victories from matching the longest streak in franchise history.
The Cavaliers failed to score 110 points for the first time, ending their NBA-record streak.
Others: The 2015-16 Golden State Warriors hold the league record after winning their first 24 games.
Hall of Fame center Wilt Chamberlain and the 1960-61 Philadelphia Warriors had held the mark with nine.
